alert.note: Alert for Nuckolls; Thayer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 11:37PM CDT until August 26 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas, including the following county, Jewell. Portions of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Nuckolls and Thayer. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1134 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last hour across much of the area, and an additional 1 inch or so is possible in parts of the area yet overnight. - This includes, but is not limited to, the following streams and drainages... Rose Creek, Dry Creek, Crosby Creek, Spring Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Deshler, Chester, Hardy, Ruskin, Byron, Hubbell and Gilead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
